sessionTitle: Event Opening
Welcome Speech and Keynote
Introduction to Office 365 Security: Configure, Manage and Monitor
sessionDescription: Moving data and applications to cloud companies represents new security and need new approaches to IT security. We’ll discover the Office 365 and Azure security features that secure your organization's services and information. Finally, we’ll explore how to leverage your updated skills to monitor and respond to security incidents. When you’re done with this session, you will have the knowledge keep your organization safe & secure in the cloud.

sessionTitle: Defender for Endpoint + MCAS = <3
sessionDescription: Within the M365 E5 licensing, we have a lot of powerful products. Two of them are Microsoft Defender for Endpoint and Microsoft Cloud App Security. In this session I'll go over both platforms, show you some best practices. And I'll show you the power of them both combined in live demo's.

sessionTitle: M365 Security and Monitoring with Graph API
sessionDescription: Security is the first thing customers have in thoughts when they talk about cloud. This is true as information is everything and keeping it secure for any business is top priority. Microsoft Graph API provide many options to connect specifically with security information and also provide ways to automate the process of managing security threats. In this session, we will explore the security Graph APIs and how we can build real world automation with Flow or custom applications to monitor and act upon threats. As a takeaway from this session, you will learn about the capabilities of security Graph APIs and what are use cases in real world.

sessionTitle: Information Barriers in MS Teams
sessionDescription:
Information barriers help to define policies that are designed to allow certain segments of users to communicate or to be isolated with each other. 
In this session, we will explore how to restrict communication and collaboration between groups to avoid a conflict of interest from occurring in your organization.

sessionTitle: Secure Microsoft 365 collaboration with Microsoft Information Protection: a real life scenario
sessionDescription:
When a working on a new confidential project, you need to make sure that collaboration (inside and outside your organization) is secured.

In this demo oriented session, as admin first, we walk you through the process of : 
• creating new sensitive information type, 
• creating a new sensitivity label, 
• configuring SPO and Teams site as well as 
• configuring an Insider Risk policy. 

Then we look at this environment from the end users point of view and show how these elements enter in action. We take you through the concepts of manual vs automatic labeling within the Microsoft Office environment and show how automatic policies in Microsoft 365 can ensure that information when sent to recipients is properly labelled and protected, even in instances of accidental oversharing. We also look at how Microsoft 365 can use Data Loss Prevention Policy Tips to educate users on the correct course of action, and be flexible enough to allow sharing outside the policy boundary when required.

Finally, we will examine what happens when someone attempts to leak information in a malicious fashion?  How Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance helps to defeat leaks in the first instance and then examine how Activity Explorer in the Data Classification dashboard can be used to detect anomalous activity to be referred to Security for further investigation.

sessionTitle: Am I Entitled? How to manage access with Azure AD Entitlements
sessionDescription:
Azure Active Directory offers many tools for managing users who access content and applications.

Entitlements allow internal and external users to requests access to sets of resources, and the lifecycle of the access request to be managed from cradle to grave.

In this session we will explore a model that allows external users to be easily invited to collaborate, with additional safe-guards in place such as 
• Agreement to terms and conditions 
• Multi-factor authentication 
• Entitlements that manage  
○ Access to resources such as applications and Microsoft Teams  
○ Publishing entitlements for internal and external users  
○ Approvals for requests○ Access reviews

sessionTitle: CyberSec and Microsoft 365 in action
sessionDescription: Discover how to secure your tenant from A to Z. From phishing, brute force to malware prevention, understand which steps to implement to harden your tenant and which features to use according to your licence level.

sessionTitle: Enhance Your M365 Forms Without Compromising Privacy & Security
sessionDescription:
There are many 3rd-party solutions offering enhanced forms & workflows for SharePoint Online. Usually customers compare features to decide which solution fits their requirements, and many overlook the most basic question: 
“What really happens when a user fills out a form and submits it? Where does the form’s data go to and where is It stored and processed?” 
In this session Nimrod Geva, Product Group Manager for KWizCom, will review the types of Forms solutions for M365. 
Nimrod will also present KWizCom Forms – a SharePoint-hosted forms & workflow app designed to assure that none of the customers’ data leave their M365 tenant.

sessionTitle: Temporary Access Pass - The key for unlocking Passwordless?
sessionDescription: Recently, Microsoft announced Temporary Access Pass. Is this the key for unlocking Passwordless in a seamless process? How does it work? In what scenarios will it be used?

sessionTitle: You are Doing IT Security Wrong - Understanding the Threat of Modern Cyber-attacks
sessionDescription:
Organizations today are vastly unprepared for the threat of modern cyber-attacks. At the same time, the attackers are becoming more sophisticated and the amount of resources at their disposal is increasing. It has become a lucrative business to hack, disrupt, and steal intellectual property from organizations of all sizes and in all business sectors. 

While the attackers are becoming more sophisticated, organizations have their IT security positioned for threats from the past century, with poor password management techniques, simple ACL based file permissions, and basic firewall and zone-based containment techniques. This makes it easier for attackers to obtain access to critical intellectual property and makes career-ruining disruptions all the more common. 

This session focuses on understanding what is currently wrong with IT security practices and how your organization can change processes, techniques, and tools to provide for a significantly higher level of IT security without necessarily having to implement expensive tools or obtrusive processes. 

• Understand the pitfalls of current IT Security practices, including myths around password change policies, allowing logins without providing multiple factors, and the proliferation of ‘always-on’ admin rights. 
• Examine how simple changes in IT strategy can greatly improve your overall IT posture, including providing for up to a 99% improvement in the likelihood of a data credential theft. 
• Determine which easy to deploy tools and features which you may already be licensed for can be used to tighten up IT security within an environment, including solutions such as Windows Hello for Business, Microsoft Defender for Identity, Azure Sentinel, Microsoft Cloud App Security, next-generation firewalls, and more.

sessionTitle: Hackers Won't Pass - Microsoft 365 Defender in action
sessionDescription:
Industry spends billions on cybersecurity, but its going worse every year. Crackers, ransomware attacks, international scandals are remind us dangerous world. But the biggest issue the matter of fact: there is a really low threshold of occurrence into "hacking". Any scriptkiddie can download a bunch of tools and play with your websites, emails servers etc. In our time to be hacked or not is a matter of statistics. To beat hackers let's think like hackers. 

In the session you will see the complete kill chain from the edge to domain admin privileges and how to stop those types of attacks. 

- Getting inside the network with email attacks. Bypassing third-party email protection.
- Privilege Escalation.
- Antivirus evasion.
- Enumerating and Exploiting Active Directory domain.
- Stop phishing attacks with Microsoft Defender for Office 365.
- Protect your modern desktop from modern attacks with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

sessionTitle: Microsoft Defender: Stop attacks and reduce security operations workload with XDR
sessionDescription: Join us to how Microsoft 365 Defender and Azure Defender work together to build a complete picture of each attack, leveraging powerful automation and integration to help you focus on being proactive and applying your knowledge to hunt across your data and customize your detection tools. A comprehensive eXtended Detection and Response solution prevents attacks and gives security professionals the tools they need to detect, investigate and remediate complex threats across their organization.

sessionTitle: Event Opening
Welcome Speech and Keynote
Remote Working with Windows Virtual Desktop
sessionDescription: This session will talk about the advantage of WVD, demo it and share the best WVD offer.

sessionTitle: How to build secure B2C Applications with Azure AD Identities
sessionDescription: We will share best practices for how you can use Azure AD External Identities to customize user journeys and enable a Zero Trust approach to securing your customer-facing applications.

sessionTitle: Build Secure and an efficient cloud landing zone
sessionDescription: The cloud environment is similar to laying a foundation in any construction project. All architects have to consider common decisions when designing and laying the foundation for any building. They all share things like concrete, rebar, and conduits to bring in necessary utilities, like plumbing or electricity. Azure landing zones, are very similar as they are all built from the common design elements. While commonalities exist across all environments, each landing zone implementation is customized to support a specific type of structure or cloud operating model. Join me to learn & build secure baseline for your cloud environment.

sessionTitle: DevSecOps with AzureDevops and responding to real time events with Azure security center
sessionDescription: This explains the process of using azure tools and plugins to azure devops to shift security left.

sessionTitle: Privacy Paradox: How can Privacy Enhancing Technology on Azure Enable Improved Data Analysis?
sessionDescription: At the heart of privacy-preserving data analysis is a fundamental “privacy paradox” – There is a need to effectively balance data utility with the level of data privacy. Can we solve this paradox through human-centric design applied to data anonymization and effectively use data for your Azure ML Journey?

sessionTitle: I find your lack of Azure Governance disturbing!
sessionDescription:
Microsoft Azure is an awesome platform to run your organization workloads. It supports Cloud native and non-native workloads. It's easy and fast to getting started. After moving and creating several resources in Azure some customers are struggling by the lack of a robust cloud governance structure. 
This session is target at organization of all sizes, not only big large organizations need governance, every single organization needs it. We will review the native services in Azure that can help you on your governance journey. We will talk and see in action: Management Groups, Azure Policy, Tags, Azure Blueprints, CAF - Cloud Adoption Framework and even a little bit of Cost Management.

sessionTitle: Manage Security Operations on Microsoft Azure using Azure Monitor
sessionDescription: Let's learn how to keep your application performance to be on control which makes sure your customer is happy. Get to know how to integrate the Log Analytics workspace with Azure Virtual Machine on which the application will be hosted, along with Log Analytics VM extension, insights on app performance, collect and query the data.

sessionTitle: Deep dive into Azure AD B2C custom policies
sessionDescription: Azure AD B2C provides us with a vast array of options to customize the user login experience. Azure B2C policies is a powerful tool for B2C login experience customization. In this session, we look into how to build Azure B2C custom policies from scratch, add custom claims, read custom claims and insert new orchestration steps etc.

sessionTitle: Kubernetes Security
sessionDescription: Kubernetes security

sessionTitle: Audit VMs with Azure Guest Configuration Policy
sessionDescription: This session will be about how you can apply Azure Guest Configuration Policy to audit your VMs, Check Compliance Showcase various Built-In Policies & it's integration with Azure Security Center.

sessionTitle: Azure ML Security and Its Significance
sessionDescription:
Discussion On Enterprise security in Azure Machine Learning.

Restrict access to resources and operations by user account or groups and various aspects for Deployment and Production environment.

sessionTitle: Top pitfalls of Microsoft Azure security and how to avoid them
sessionDescription:
Did you know that contrary to popular belief, the most common cloud security threats are not outside attacks, but rather misconfigurations? To fully secure public cloud platforms, we need to understand them deeply. This requires both upskilling existing information security office with cloud expertise and shifting the way security responsibilities are spread across the organization.

I have assessed the security hundreds of solutions built on the Microsoft Azure cloud and found that there are some key security pitfalls that are common across all industry verticals and company sizes. In this session, I will share what these security pitfalls are, why do they matter and how to mitigate them.

sessionTitle: Event Opening
Welcome Speech and Keynote
Modern Management with MEM Intune & Security Policies
sessionDescription: AVD Enrollment Experience with Modern Management Intune. Let's check the significant efforts we all need to put into Moving away from Group policy. CIS baselines are benchmark systems for the traditional VDI and PC management world.

sessionTitle: Secure Infrastructure with Microsoft Defender for Identity
sessionDescription: In this session, we will talk about Microsoft Defender for Identity, Defender for identity architecture and how can we leverage it to identify, detect, and investigate advanced threats, compromised identities, and malicious insider actions directed at your organization.

sessionTitle: Using the SPF, DKIM and DMARC Frameworks to reduce Spoofing in Office 365
sessionDescription:
Information theft is becoming rampant. Every week we hear of well known companies being hacked and customer information stoken. Why? Hackers then either sell this information to email hackers, or use it themselves to creatw fake email and messages, targeting both the unsuspecting public, your customers, or even your own users, for financial and other malicious gains.

This is because Email lacks the ability to verify authenticity of all received mails. Fraudsters have taken advantage of this fundamental flaw to full advantage.

3 Frameworks, SPF in April 2014, DKIM in 2011, and DMARC in 2015. Together, these 3 frameworks work in tandem to help combat email fraud.

Many security devices and email providers have adopted these standards, including Microsoft Office 365 and Google.

However, these frameworks are often misunderstood. This session explains how these frameworks help prevent mail fraud and why adopting these frameworks in an organization would help both their own users, and their customers, suppliers or even the general public from being spoofed by fraudsters using the organization's email domain.

sessionTitle: Azure AD Verifiable Credentials - verify once, use everywhere
sessionDescription:
Understand why Microsoft is investing in decentralized identities Understand what Verifiable Credentials are and how they work?
We will share scenarios & show some demos for use cases that customers have explored!

sessionTitle: Power Platform CoE Starter Kit - Overview
sessionDescription: Prerequisites, setup instructions, and individual components of the CoE Starter Kit.

sessionTitle: Zero Trust for Modern Workplace
sessionDescription: Have Zero Trust mindset: Trust nothing, verify everything.

sessionTitle: Microsoft Identity Platform and OAuth 2.0 for beginners
sessionDescription:
Are you a beginner developer in the Microsoft Development eco system? Do you build custom Azure portals or automations that interact with authenticated APIs? Do you work with SPFx and/or MS Teams custom solutions?

If Yes, attend this session to understand the basics of Authentication available to you and which flow to use for which scenarios.

sessionTitle: Secure your Data - All About Power Platform Data Loss Prevention
sessionDescription:
To protect data in your organization, you can use Power Platform Admin to create and enforce policies that define the consumer connectors that specific business data can be shared with. These policies are called data loss prevention (DLP) policies. DLP policies ensure that data is managed in a uniform manner across your organization, and they prevent important business data from being accidentally published to connectors such as social media sites.

This session will help you through the end-to-end experience of creating Data Loss Prevention and handle data access policies.

How do we setup?
In this session, I will show the end to end demo!

What attendees expect to learn?
They learn how to setup / deploy Data loss prevention for Power Platform.

sessionTitle: A Day in the Life of an Azure Sentinel Analyst
sessionDescription: Learn Azure Sentinel by taking a tour through console as an actual analyst will do every single day as part of a broader SOC environment. Hear how Azure Sentinel has been developed to help modernize and efficientize security to enable security teams to do more in less time.

sessionTitle: Azure Sentinel Hunting with KQL queries
sessionDescription:
Telemetry data collected using the Azure Sentinel is stored into the Log Analytics workspace.

KQL query are the read only commands that are executed over the Log analytics workspace to read the collected telemetry

KQL is the query language used to perform analysis on data to analyze the collected telemetry, represent over the dashboards using the workbooks, and perform hunting in Azure Sentinel to do the proactively hunt for cyber threats. 

Most of us come across the situation where we have to write some custom KQL query to configure hunting query or custom alert analytics rule or workbook

Its quite important to know basic of KQL because it can help individual in understanding the telemetry

KQL can help you in projecting data on the Azure Dashboards. Also in setting up the Sentinel Alert rules to generate incidents, alerts

In this session, I will give brief overview of how KQL is used, wow to write KQL query and approach that need to be used to design KQL queries

This will help participants in understanding the basics of KQL and structure of the KQL queries.

sessionTitle: Microsoft 365 Virtual Marathon Teams Bombing and Lessons Learned
sessionDescription:
Running a global event with thousands of attendees spread across 115 countries and speakers in nearly every time zone took serious coordination, but what happens when you have an attacker who comes through the door that everyone else does?

Teams bombing is real and the attackers have tools to ruin the experience for users. We’ll dive into our experience and lessons learned.

In this session we’ll explore Microsoft Teams security and policies in the context of events and cover security in new webinar features.

sessionTitle: Few Security tips for N-Tier app in Azure
sessionDescription:
1. Blazor WASM UI gets authenticated and passes the JWT to APIM.
2. APIM Validates the JWT and routes the request to Web API.
3. SQL Server and Redis Cache’s credentials are stored in Azure Key Vault.
4. Web API uses the credentials from Azure Key Vault.
5. Web API investigates Azure Redis Cache before hitting SQL Azure. (Cache Aside Pattern)
6. We will perform Dacpac (.sqlproj) for the deployment of SQL Data Store.
